alert.note: Alert for Escambia Coastal (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 4:04PM EDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Escambia County through 345 PM CDT... At 304 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm over Myrtle Grove, or over West Pensacola, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Pensacola, Brent, West Pensacola, Warrington, Goulding and Myrtle Grove. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
